answer:
Your aircraft tail number, your aircraft type (e.g. C152), your position, your destination, your intended cruising altitude.

During this process, ATC may provide you with a discrete squawk code, the altimeter setting at the nearest airport (to which you should adjust your altimeter), and may ask you to verify your current altitude and location at which they see you on radar.
question: What information will you need to provide ATC when requesting VFR flight following (VFR traffic advisories)?
